Posted By: SirZapdos (11/15/2011 11:38:48 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This guy's flavor, along with all the unfinished business on Mirrodin (Karn might help if he fixes up the rest of the oil, Urabrask comtemplating the Mirrans' dilemma, Melira healing people) makes me wonder if Wizards had a reason for tradmarking *Mirrodin Pure*.

Posted By: dlgn (5/4/2012 10:15:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Use him as my EDH general and LOVE him. My favorite combo is to put [Konda's Banner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Konda's Banner) on him with a [Spirit Mantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spirit Mantle) and an [Inquisitor's Flail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisitor's Flail).  
  
An unblockable 11/7 that deals double damage (Happens to be over 21 too).   
  
No Spirit Mantle? No Problem, just cast [Seize the Day](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seize the Day) on him and flashback it for another opponent next turn.

posts.post_content: Huh. This guy contradicts the flavor text on [Dispense Justice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dispense Justice). He is clearly an Accorder, and he clearly strikes first: he has First Strike.

posts.post_content:
"As long as my hand holds this [Nuisance Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nuisance Engine), there's hope for a pure Mirrodin once again."  
~Paraphrased Jor Kadeen, the Prevailer  
  
I really like this guy, I also kinda like that it seems like everyone hated him to death in standard because it means that I found a set of 4 foils of him for a whopping $1 American. Happy day for me! :P

Posted By: DritzD27 (7/17/2012 1:34:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Incredible Red/White General, the kind of damage this guy can throw around has to be seen to be believed.  
  
Something nice about Jor is that he synergises well with cards already likely to be in a Commander deck anyway. [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves), [Sol Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sol Ring), [Swiftfoot Boots](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swiftfoot Boots).   
  
I like to play him with a lot of mana acceleration artifacts and creatures like [Boros Signet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Signet) and [Iron Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iron Myr)/[Gold Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gold Myr), and creatures that either themselves benefit from metalcraft or Jor's passive ability (think [Auriok Edgewright](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auriok Edgewright), [Bloodshot Trainee](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodshot Trainee) or [Hearthfire Hobgoblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hearthfire Hobgoblin).  
  
Token makers are also extremely vicious with the extra 3 power and luckily white is full of cards you could stick in the deck. [Myrsmith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Myrsmith) [Increasing Devotion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Increasing Devotion) [Conqueror's Pledge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Conqueror's Pledge). If the game runs on and you have ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Fuyoc (6/5/2012 8:42:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5/4 first strike for 5 CMC in limited would be great. 8/4 first strike with metalcraft is amazing. Giving all your other guys +3/0 is a game ender.
  
   
Less devastating in constructed, but still has the potential to be very good in the right deck.

Posted By: Nighthawk42 (5/11/2011 8:04:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not every legendary has to be central to the story, or even appear in the story beyond a cameo. Sometimes, a creature is legendary because they want an effect that they don't want multiples of on the 'field.  
  
Jor Kadeen is clearly a member of the remaining Mirran resistance, obviously in a leadership role, possibly a field commander. He's not in charge of the outfit (that's Melira), he's not concerned with the defense of the survivors (Melira again), he's focused on striking back against the Phyrexians, fervently believing that they still have a chance to reclaim their world.  
  
I got all that solely from reading the card.
posts.html:

He's not in charge of the outfit (that's Melira), he's not concerned with the defense of the survivors (Melira again), he's focused on striking back against the Phyrexians, fervently believing that they still have a chance to reclaim their world.

Posted By: Atali (4/29/2011 9:56:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
With this guy and [Melira](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=194274) leading the resistance, and [Urabrask](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=214378) backing them as support, there is no way that Wizards isn't coming back to this plane in the future.  
  
If you're running monowhite equipment, this guy makes splashing red definitely worth it. With [Goblin Gaveleer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Gaveleer), [Galavonic Blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Galavonic Blast) and [Hellkite Igniter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellkite Igniter) already in the block, if you weren't already doing this, you have little excuse not to now.  
  
@IntrnetHte  
  
I guess "backing" is a strong word choice. He's definitely harboring them. I think I read somewhere that he's the least "devout" of the praetors. Maybe he'll defect. I just know that flavor-wise, he doesn't seem very Phyrexian (i'm talking about the card) and red is the least corrupted color as far as infect goes.
posts.html:

Posted By: SarpNasty (8/29/2011 6:52:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If you hadn't realized, this guy is probably THE BEST Red White general there is. I've played a few others. [Brion Stoutarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brion Stoutarm) is darn fun (especially in a dedicated Giant theme deck), but it is incredible how ridiculous this guy can be.  
  
[White Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=White Sun's Zenith) and [Martial Coup](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Martial Coup) are some of this guy's best friends. Play the Zenith at the end step of the turn right before yours, and swing in with 5/2 cats. That doesn't count any other pumps you might get with... [Glorious Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glorious Anthem), or (my favorite) [Marshal's Anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marshal's Anthem)... BUT. The absolute best move you can make.  
  
[Elemental Mastery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elemental Mastery).  
  
Drop [Elemental Mastery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elemental Mastery) on Kadeen, and you've got 8 4/1 Elementals with Haste, and you don't have to worry about losing creatures. Or maybe the game hasn't treated you so well yet. And you are on the back foot. Holding Kadeen back, and tapping to make 8 4/1 blockers sounds like a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
